divs: sighting detailsaugust 8th, 2006 \ kirtland afb \ flightline approx. 7:15pm = as i moved around one of our aircraft in order to fuel it, i noticed a very bright light at an altitude near the clouds. this bright light was west of albuquerque and south of the volcanoes. initially, i thought it was an unusually bright star for this time of day since there was plenty of daylight left. i stopped what i was doing to observe the light\object since it was too unusual. approx. 7:17pm = as i watched the light\object, it "blinked out" all of the sudden only to reappear north & above of the 1st location. i watched it again until approx. 7:20pm when it "blinked out" again. approx. 7:20pm = the light\object reappeared south & below of the 1st location and i watched it until it once again "blinked out". approx. 7:21pm = the light\object reappeared north of its 3rd location. i watched it once again until approx. 7:25pm when i diverted my attention to 2 f-18s taking off in an easterly direction, which then looped south and then west. i returned my attention to the direction of the light\object, but it was nowhere to be found. playing on a feeling that the f-18s were on an intercept course, i returned my attention to the jets. approx. 7:26pm = both f-18s climbed altitude and continued heading west. approx. 7:30pm = both f-18s ended up in the general area of the light\object's last location which was no longer in the area as far as i could tell. note: for a better perspective of the sighting, the above mentioned volcanoes are roughly 10 miles away from me and the light\object appeared to be further out...possibly 15 miles give or take a mile. i've been working on & around aircraft for around 16 years, and been flying in them for double that time, so if there's one thing i know it's aircraft. that sounds like a cliche doesn't it? the light\object was not any type of aircraft, nor could it have been a star. besides, why would 2 f-18s appear to "scramble" toward it if it was indeed nothing? i'm sorry i don't have a photo or video of the event. the military tends to frown upon cameras and video equipment on the flightline, so i did the next best thing and made as detailed a report as possible and i drew a sketch, but i no longer have a working scanner. i'll try to submit the sketch at a later date. mufon field investigator trainee
Summary: Bright object doing (maneuvers?) west of Albuqueruque airport.
